input:
1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.
What brings you in today?
output:
THINKING: The doctor wants to know why we're here today, but I'm not really sure what to say. Maybe I should just tell the truth — that I feel weird, and I keep falling, even more than usual. I might also mention the skin on my hands and feet is really dry and thick, and I don't know if that’s related. I feel nervous about all this.

ANSWER: Well, I guess I’ve been falling a lot more than before, and my legs feel really heavy and strange sometimes. My skin on my hands and feet has been getting really dry and rough, and I don’t know why. It’s all kind of confusing and makes me worried.

input: 1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.Can you tell me more about how these symptoms have been affecting your daily life, and if you've noticed any other changes or concerns you'd like to share?
output: It’s been really hard, I guess. I fall a lot and can’t walk straight sometimes, and my skin feels really dry and itchy all the time. I’ve been worried because I feel different from other kids and I get tired easily.

input: 1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.Can you tell me how these symptoms started and how they have changed over time, and whether there are any activities or situations that seem to make them better or worse?
output: Well, it kinda started when he was little, and he just wasn’t walking right like other kids. Now, he falls a lot and feels wobbly even just standing. Sometimes, when he’s running or playing, he gets maybe more tired or shaky. I don’t know if there's anything that makes it better, but he seems sad or frustrated sometimes, especially when he can’t do what other children can.

input: 1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.Can you tell me more about how your child's symptoms have affected their daily activities, like playing or school, and whether there are any particular moments or activities that seem to make the symptoms better or worse?
output: Uh, he struggles a lot with walking and stuff, like he falls a lot even when he's trying to play or go to school. Sometimes he's trying to do things, but then his legs get really stiff or tingly, and he can't move right. I guess when he's rested or not moving around much, he seems a little better, but we're not really sure what makes it better or worse exactly.

input: 1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.Has your child experienced any episodes of numbness, tingling, or weakness in the arms or other parts of the body besides the legs?
output: Sometimes, he says his arms feel kind of funny or numb, like there's a strange sensation, but other times he doesn’t say anything about it. It’s confusing because he might forget or not always mention it.

input: 1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.Have you or your child noticed any problems with sweating, blood pressure changes when standing, difficulty with bowel or bladder control, or other signs of autonomic nervous system involvement?
output: Um, I think he sometimes seems a little sweaty when he’s playing, but I’m not sure if that’s normal or not. As for the other stuff, I haven’t really noticed anything strange with his tummy or bathroom or blood pressure, but I don’t always know what to look for.

input: 1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.Has there been any family history of similar symptoms, gait problems, or neurological conditions?
output: Um, yeah, there’s my cousin… she had some skin on her hands and feet, and I think her head was kind of different too. But I’m not sure how much that matters.

input: 1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.Has your child noticed if their symptoms get worse after playing or walking for a long time, and do they find that resting helps them feel better?
output: Yes, sometimes after playing or walking for a while, he seems really tired and his legs get shaky. Resting kind of helps him feel a little better, but he still looks pretty tired afterward.

input: 1. A 7-year-old boy was brought to the neurology clinic due to developmental delays and frequent falls. His parents report he has difficulty walking and often loses his balance. On examination, he exhibits spasticity and peripheral neuropathy signs such as decreased sensation in the lower limbs. Skin evaluation reveals thickened hyperkeratotic plaques on the palms and soles along with generalized dry, scaly skin consistent with ichthyosis. Brain MRI shows abnormalities in cortical development suggestive of cerebral dysgenesis. He has a history of seizures starting at age 3, controlled with medication. Family history is notable for a cousin with similar skin and neurological symptoms. Genetic testing is underway to confirm a suspected diagnosis of cerebral dysgenesis, neuropathy, ichthyosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma syndrome.Has your child noticed if their symptoms, such as weakness or heaviness in the legs, tend to get worse after playing or walking for a long time, and do they find that resting helps them feel better?
output: Um, sometimes after running around or walking a lot, he looks like he's really tired and his legs get kind of heavy, and he doesn’t want to move much. Resting seems to help a little, but then he gets tired again pretty fast.
